name: Ayres Hotel & Suites in Costa Mesa - Newport Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely no complaints about the 2 nights we stayed here.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: Located right between Costa Mesa and Newport Beach. Hotel was beatifully decorated and room was very comfortable. We had a Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom which was nice. Complementary breakfast was great and parking was free (very rare for any hotel in Southern Cal). 5 minutes to Fashion Island and convinient to freeways and restaurants.
reviews.title: Some pluses, some minuses

reviews.text: We had a family get-together in mid-January. Five rooms were reserved; my husband and I stayed 5 nights: Weds till following Monday.
reviews.title: Nice rooms - parking stinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pluses: Free parking... compared to many hotels in metro areas now charging daily parking fees of $12-18. Hot breakfast ... including made to order omelettes and other egg dishes, but only during the week since hotel seems to cater to business travelers rather than leisure...fresh fruits selections very limited; after 5 mornings; breakfast got to be "boring": same 2 or 3 choices of cold cereal and other breakfast "starchy" food. Effective Sound-proof windows ... very necessary since the hotel is right under the flight path of John Wayne Arpt. Prompt response for extra blanket and towels. Adequate room size. Oh ... and there is also free evening refreshment M-F.
reviews.title: It was Okay. . .Far from the beaches. . .
Nice Hotel for the Price
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. It was clean and comfortable. We stayed at the Ayres because the Disneyland properties were both full and expensive during spring break. The drive was only about 10 to 15 minutes to Disneyland and less than 5 minutes away from the John Wayne Airport. The staff was very friendly and the full complimentary breakfast was a plus. This saved us quite a bit of money because there were 7 of us and I prefer a real breakfast to get the day started than a continental breakfast of just pastry and juice. I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Watch Your Wallet
reviews.text: The hotel was fine, but I was not pleased with the service. When I checked in, I was told that my suite would be $159.00 per night on Friday night.. When I left, the bill read $189.00 per night. I was told I was "bumped" to a better room because the hotel was almost sold out.

reviews.title: Great night's sleep at Ayres!
reviews.text: I've read good things about Ayres, but l'll never return to the one in Newport Beach.

We were very pleased with the Ayres Hotel. The rooms and the hotel were very clean, the complimentary breakfast was more than satisfactory, and the staff was friendly. The highlight of the stay was their beds - according to the sign in the lobby, they're custom designed for the hotel chain. The mattresses are "double-pillow-top" and the down pillows are awesome - so incredible, in fact, that I had to find the tag so I can try to get them for my own bed!
reviews.title: A Must Stay While In The LA Area
We liked this hotel
reviews.text: My only complaint is that the light/fan in the bathroom was noisy, but it may just be something that needs a quick repair. The hotel is close to the John Wayne airport, and when sitting outside, you can hear the air traffic; however, we did not hear the planes at all during the night.

reviews.title: Quiet and clean
reviews.text: We just spent 2 night at this hotel and slept like we were at home, the bed was so comfortable! The staff was always friendly, the room very clean and promptly serviced and the location excellent for our needs. The breakfast was hearty, not a continental breakfast, with some choices. We need to return next month and booked our reservation as we checked out. It also was quiet and felt very safe. We have been returning to this area for over 16 years to visit family and found this to be a most comfortable destination, much quieter than staying at the beach!

reviews.title: Definitely won't return
reviews.text: We attended a wedding reception and were guests of the hotel for 3 nights. Housekeeping service was non-existent or lacking - had to call to get the room made up (which didn't happen) or request towels (one set was available for two people), toiletries, restock coffee packet and toilet tissue. We were to have early check-in and complimentary cheese tray/champagne but was not received. Staff at front desk is disinterested. Breakfast was the same each of the 3 days and if you got there near the 'end' of service time, don't expect fresh coffee or food 'refreshed'.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on Saturday and paid $72.00 for the night, and we were even able to check in at 1 pm. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was clean and comfortable. The room was very clean and quite spacious with a leather sofa sleeper. The bed was very soft and plush, it was like sleeping in your own bed (maybe even better). We were surprised to find that even the floor was soft (which is unusual). We stood on the 3rd floor and had a nice view of the pool. In the evening the front desk has the best fresh, hot, homemade cookies you've ever tasted. We didn't try the breakfast because we were late, but the complimentary apples were crisp and delicious. We would definetly recommend this hotel and stay here again! It was close to the John Wayne Airport so we heard a few planes overhead, but nothing bothersome. This hotel was centrally located, which made going places very easy to get to.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: I stayed for a weekend with a friend who was attending a conference.

Just stayed here for 4 days while near L.A. for business and it was an excellent hotel. Even though the hotel was close the the airport the planes didn't really start until 6-7 in the morning and I never heard them in the early evening. The breakfast in the morning was excellent and I have to say that the beds were the most comfortable that I have ever slept in. It was funny that when I got home I was thinking that I wasn't looking forward to getting into my own bed as I would much rather sleep in the one at the hotel!! The "European-inspired" look of the hotel was cute and not too over done and the courtyard in the middle was very nice to sit and relax in. I would stay here again on business but it was a little far from the action if I were to go for a holiday ( if you don't mind driving to get to the shopping and touristy stuff then it was a very nice, clean and safe area around the hotel).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel.

reviews.text: Two nights at the Ayres. I have stayed in several of their properties and this one is one of the nicer I have been in.
reviews.title: Nice place all in all...

likes.disliked: — the charge for internet and no WI-FI in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a room on the west side of the out-building and never heard a plane for which I was pleasantly surprised. The room was large, the furnishings extremely rich (too much for my taste, but I do not own it) and very comfortable. The bed was comfortable, a big deal with me, and there was a fridge and microwave.
reviews.title: Not the worst, not the best...

reviews.text: The breakfast is a real breakfast with real eggs, not the gross frozen re-heated kind, bacon, potatoes, cereals, toast etc.
reviews.title: Lked it well enough

reviews.text: There is free wi-fi in the lobby only, the internet access in the rooms has a 2 foot cable and costs about $9/day. That always annoys me!! I luckily carry a 10 foot cable so at least I could see the TV and work on my laptop. Charging for internet is such an annoyance to me, it isnt even my money but if you are going to run a nice hotel internet should be free, even the dicey comfort inn I stayed in last year had free wi-fi in the rooms for crying out loud.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay @ Ayres Hotel and Suites

likes.liked: — Nice Room and Free Great Breakfast
likes.disliked: — Pool was being worked on so no swimming

aka: Ayres Hotel And Suites In Costa Mesa - Newport Beach
description: The charm and elegance of a European-inspired boutique hotel awaits you! You’ll find all of the 284 luxurious guest rooms at Ayres Hotel & Suites Costa Mesa are impeccably appointed with a full suite of complimentary amenities including our signature, triple sheeted Ayres Dream Sleeper beds, flat screen TVs, refrigerators, microwaves, coffeemakers, well lit work desks and Wifi, MP3 radios, and hairdryers. Every morning you will start your day right with our complimentary full American breakfast.A stay at our Costa Mesa hotel means you'll be just moments from some of the biggest California attractions. Only just down the street, you will find the most prestigious shopping mall in Orange County, South Coast Plaza, with stores like Tiffany's and Bloomingdale's. For the theater buffs, the Segerstrom Center for the Arts is only 3 miles away and engages audiences with a broad range of productions in music, dance, and theater. The Orange County Fairgrounds, mere minutes away from the Ayres Hotel and Suites Costa Mesa, plays host to numerous festivals and fairs. The most famous is the Orange County Fair with tons of rides, attractions, and fair food which takes place every Summer. For those coming to California for its pristine beaches, Newport Beach is close by and absolutely breathtaking. Balboa Island is also a short ferry ride away from the nearby Balboa Peninsula and provides great family fun with fair rides and attractions. Explore everything Orange County has to offer when you visit our exceptional Costa Mesa hotel in the heart of the OC.
